intro: Goniothalamus malayanus var. dispermus, commonly known as the Malayan goniothalamus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are bisexual and exhibit a unique structure with a prominent, fleshy calyx. The fruit is a berry that contains multiple seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
